problems.description: Source totes not entering pick station

solutions.instructions: Explain how to set pick station to 'picking mode'

solutions.description: Check if tote is in the sequence
solutions.instructions: The load unit may have been physically removed and cannot be located by the system. Check if it is in the sequence.

solutions.description: Check if sensor is blocked on the infeed lane to the pick station
solutions.instructions: Explain how to check if sensor is blocked on the infeed lane to the pick station

1. Enter the OSR from the front using the correct Rack line access procedure.
2. Locate the buffer in fault and check to see that the sensor which crosses parallel with the lift is clear.
2.1. If there is a skewed tote, place it on the centre of the lift (tote must not cover the outer sensors on the lift)
2.2 If it is clear, make sure that both blue and orange lights, on the sensor, are illuminated. It may need to be aligned with the reflector opposite.
3. Exit the OSR and make sure that the lift is activated.

steps.description: Enter the OSR from the front using the correct Rack line access procedure.
Locate the buffer in fault and check to see that the sensor which crosses parallel with the lift is clear.
substeps: If there is a skewed tote, place it on the centre of the lift (tote must not cover the outer sensors on the lift)
If it is clear, make sure that both blue and orange lights, on the sensor, are illuminated. It may need to be aligned with the reflector opposite.

steps.description: Exit the OSR and make sure that the lift is activated.

problems.description: Open Shuttle will not GET from transfer lanes or PUT to dispatch ramp whilst error is apparent.

steps.description: Switching OFF
substeps: Locate the 'System Off' (Black) button on the lower left-hand side of the Shuttle.

Press 'System OFF' for 2 seconds. The LEDs on the shuttle will start to flash RED to signal that the navigation computer is shutting down. When all light signals on the vehicle go out, it is completely switched off. This can take up to 1 minute.

steps.description: Switching ON
substeps: Locate the 'System ON' (White) button on the lower left-hand side of the Shuttle.

Press 'System ON' for 2 seconds. The start-up procedure activates, during this time the vehicle starts its control system and then the navigation computer. These processes are displayed using different light patterns.
For the Open Shuttle to resume Automatic functions, set the 'Automatic Control Mode' from the Incubed IT Software.

steps.description: Log issue using the link bellow. Try uploading a photo to help KNAPP team in the investigation of the issue.

problems.description: Error resolves in some instances and continues operation but other times the Open Shuttle will need to be restarted to resolve the issue.

steps.description: Switching OFF
substeps: Locate the 'System Off' (Black) button on the lower left-hand side of the Shuttle.

Press 'System OFF' for 2 seconds. The LEDs on the shuttle will start to flash RED to signal that the navigation computer is shutting down. When all light signals on the vehicle go out, it is completely switched off. This can take up to 1 minute.

steps.description: Switching ON
substeps: Locate the 'System ON' (White) button on the lower left-hand side of the Shuttle.

Press 'System ON' for 2 seconds. The start-up procedure activates, during this time the vehicle starts its control system and then the navigation computer. These processes are displayed using different light patterns.
For the Open Shuttle to resume Automatic functions, set the 'Automatic Control Mode' from the Incubed IT Software.

steps.description: Log issue using the link bellow. Try uploading a photo to help KNAPP team in the investigation of the issue.
Go to the Incubed software to investigate the standstill
substeps: Determine which shuttle needs to complete a  priority task (eg. deliver target totes to dispatch ramp).

steps.description: Once determined, manually move the obstructing shuttle clear of the priority shuttle.
Wait until the priority shuttle has passed through to complete its task then re-enable manually moved shuttle
Remove the first tote and take it to a Kisoft station to check the order destination.
substeps: If the Open Shuttle does not change state to deliver the second tote, the second tote will also need to be removed.
Once all affected totes are removed the Open Shuttle will resume workload automatically.

solutions.instructions:
Using compressed air or similar (Blower) try to remove any dust/debris from the lens of the scanner. (BE CAREFUL TO NOT SCRATCH THE LENS)

If possible, using a clean microfibre cloth, wipe the lens to remove any excess grime.

Using compressed air or similar (Blower) try to remove any dust/debris from the lens of the scanner. (BE CAREFUL TO NOT SCRATCH THE LENS)

If possible, using a clean microfibre cloth, wipe the lens to remove any excess grime.

steps.description: Determine and, if necessary, rectify the cause of the emergency stop.
Check whether a safe restart is possible.
Deactivate emergency stop button (Refer Fig, Item #1).
substeps: The blue acknowledgement button flashes (Refer Fig, Item #2).

steps.description: Press the acknowledgement button, when:
substeps: The acknowledgement button goes dark
All LED indicators light up green
The power supply of the drive motors is re-established
Brakes are released An audible start signal sounds
Open Shuttle starts moving again

problems.description: Sensor/light barrier Misaligned / Error on Shuttle
problems.question: What is the sensor's light status?

solutions.instructions:
Align sensor to the reflector. Blinking signifies that the sensor beam is on the very edge of the reflector. 

If you can't adjust sensor without the aid of tools, finish troubleshoot and contact the onsite technician to assist you.

userResponses.description: Solid green but no orange light visible

solutions.instructions: Unload Open Shuttle, then check loading status. If loading status is not correct, restart Open Shuttle.

steps.description: Align sensor to the reflector. Blinking signifies that the sensor beam is on the very edge of the reflector.
If you can't adjust sensor without the aid of tools, finish troubleshoot and contact the onsite technician to assist you.
Check the Incubed software to determine if the loading status is correct (loaded or empty Shuttle).
substeps: If the status is not correct – Restart the Open Shuttle.

steps.description: Switching OFF
substeps: Locate the 'System Off' (Black) button on the lower left-hand side of the Shuttle.

Press 'System OFF' for 2 seconds. The LEDs on the shuttle will start to flash RED to signal that the navigation computer is shutting down. When all light signals on the vehicle go out, it is completely switched off. This can take up to 1 minute.

steps.description: Switching ON
substeps: Locate the 'System ON' (White) button on the lower left-hand side of the Shuttle.

Press 'System ON' for 2 seconds. The start-up procedure activates, during this time the vehicle starts its control system and then the navigation computer. These processes are displayed using different light patterns.
For the Open Shuttle to resume Automatic functions, set the 'Automatic Control Mode' from the Incubed IT Software.

steps.description: Log issue using the link bellow. Try uploading a photo to help KNAPP team in the investigation of the issue.
Lock the transfer lane which is impacted, using the Incubed software. This is to prevent target totes from being assigned to the lane.
Log a Zendesk ticket with a priority 3, ask for KNAPP to reset the Open Shuttle server and SRC for the impacted lane.
Wait for a 'RECOVERED' response from the KNAPP Service desk, via email, and inspect the impacted lane for recovery confirmation
substeps: If not recovered, update the Zendesk ticket to reflect the situation

steps.description: Update the Zendesk ticket with information on lane recovery
Unlock lane using Incubed software
substeps: If totes do not start entering the lane, update the Zendesk ticket to refect
